Introduction.Name: Dark Elves

Magic.Name: The Lore of Dark Magic
Magic.Alternative: Lore of Fire, Shadow, Metal, Death

Introduction.Annotation:
The Dark Elves, or the Druchii as they call themselves in their own tongue, also known as the Naggarothi or the "Dark Ones", are one of the most ancient, powerful, and certainly the most sadistic of the three Elven civilisations of the world.

In the bleak, chilly lands of the continent of Naggaroth in the New World lies the Dark Elven kingdoms of the Witch King Malekith, a realm born from the depths of malice and hate, a kingdom that seeks nothing more than to despoil a world its people believe loathes their existence. With malevolent eyes, the Dark Elves watch this dying world, knowing it is their birthright to rule all that they survey and those that live upon it are born to do nothing more than to grovel at their feet.

The Druchii are raiders, slavers and heartless reavers of the first degree, their every whim being nothing more than to sow misery and pain to all that oppose them, for misery and pain is the very lifeblood of their existence. Thus do their Black Arks and Corsair Fleets ply the great waters of the world, raiding and enslaving all before them as a tribute to their own avaricious desires.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.Rule: +1 to dispell
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: Automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Deathmask
Artefact.Description: The character causes terror

Artefact.Name: The Hydra's Teeth
Artefact.Rule: Five Hydra's Teeth
Artefact.Description: The model has five Hydra's Teeth. Each can be used once as a thrown weapon with a range of 12". Declare how many of its Hydra's Teeth the model is throwing before rolling to hit - there is no 'multiple shots' penalty for throwing more than one tooth at a time. For each hit. make D6 WS2 S3 close combat attacks against the target unit. Up to two attacks per turn can be allocated by the Dark Elves player against each character or Champion in the unit.

Artefact.Name: Crystal of Midnight
Artefact.Rule: Enemy Wizard must pass a Leadership test on 3D6 otherwise they forget one randomly spell. One use only.
Artefact.Description: One use only. Nominate another Wizard anywhere on the table at the start of any Dark Elves turn. The Wizard must pass a Leadership test on 3D6 otherwise they forget one randomly determined spell for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Black Dragon Egg
Artefact.Rule: Toughness 6 and the Noxious Breath attack for 1 turn. One use only.
Artefact.Description: One use only. The model may consume the Black Dragon Egg at the start of any player turn. For the remainder of that turn the model has Toughness 6 and the Noxious Breath attack.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Strength
Artefact.Rule: Strength +3 for 1 turn. One use only.
Artefact.Description: One use only. The model may drink this at the start of any close combat and it lasts until the start of the next player's turn. While it is in effect, the Potion of Strength grants +3 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Gem of Nightmares
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Gem of Nightmares can be used at the start of any turn. Until the end of that turn, the model and any unit it has joined cause Fear.

Artefact.Name: The Guiding Eye
Artefact.Rule: The character and any unit he joins may re-roll missed shooting to hit rolls. One use only.
Artefact.Description: One use only. The character and any unit he joins may re-roll missed shooting to hit rolls.

Artefact.Name: Venom Sword
Artefact.Rule: Any model that takes a wound from the Venom Sword (after saves, etc) must roll equal to or under its Toughness on 2D6 or automatically lose all remaining wounds.
Artefact.Description: Any model that takes a wound from the Venom Sword (after saves, etc) must roll equal to or under its Toughness on 2D6 or automatically lose all remaining wounds.

Artefact.Name: Rending Stars
Artefact.Rule: Maximum Range: 12"; Strength: As user+1. Rules: Thrown weapon; multiple shot x3.
Artefact.Description: Maximum Range: 12"; Strength: As user+1.\nRules: Thrown weapon; multiple shot x3.

Artefact.Name: Dance of Doom
Artefact.Description: The model has a 5+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Touch of Death
Artefact.Description: The model has killing blow

Artefact.Name: Rune of Khaine
Artefact.Rule: The model has +D3 Attacks (rolled just before making the model's attacks)
Artefact.Description: The model has +D3 Attacks (rolled just before making the model's attacks)

Artefact.Name: Witchbrew
Artefact.Rule: Witchbrew affects the Hag's unit for the entire battle. Enemy units cannot claim combat resolution bonuses for outnumbering, flank or rear attacks, or higher ground if they are only fighting a unit affected by Witchbrew
Artefact.Description: Witchbrew affects the Hag's unit for the entire battle. Enemy units cannot claim combat resolution bonuses for outnumbering, flank or rear attacks, or higher ground if they are only fighting a unit affected by Witchbrew

Artefact.Name: Cloak of Twilight
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, power level 3. The Cloak of Twilight contains the Steed of Shadows spell from the Lore of Shadows
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level 3. The Cloak of Twilight contains the Steed of Shadows spell from the Lore of Shadows.

Artefact.Name: Hand of Khaine
Artefact.Rule: One model in base contact chosen by the Dark Elves player, or the model's opponent in a challenge, loses one Attack (to a minimum of 1)
Artefact.Description: One model in base contact chosen by the Dark Elves player, or the model's opponent in a challenge, loses one Attack (to a minimum of 1). Against mounted models, the Dark Elves player must choose either the mount or the rider. If the model has special types of attack (a Giant, for example) the Hand of Khaine has no effect. Models that are Immune to Psychology are unaffected by the Hand of Khaine.

Artefact.Name: Cry of War
Artefact.Rule: A unit charged by a warrior with a Cry of War must pass a Leadership test or reduce their Weapon Skill by 1 (to a minimum of 1) for that Close Combat
Artefact.Description: A unit charged by a warrior with a Cry of War must pass a Leadership test or reduce their Weapon Skill by 1 (to a minimum of 1) for that Close Combat.

Artefact.Name: Manbane
Artefact.Rule: A model counts Strength as one higher than their target's Toughness
Artefact.Description: A model with a weapon coated with Manbane always counts their Strength as one higher than their target's Toughness, unless their Strength would normally be more than this, up to a maximum of Strength 6. This means that they almost always wound opponents on a roll of 3+. This modified Strength is used to calculate armour save modifiers.

Artefact.Name: Black Lotus
Artefact.Description: The model may re-roll any dice that score a 1 when rolling to wound with a weapon coated With Black Lotus.

Artefact.Name: Dark Venom
Artefact.Rule: Wounds inflicted in the challenge that round are doubled for the purposes of combat resolution scores
Artefact.Description: If a model with Dark Venom slays an enemy in a challenge, all wounds inflicted by the model in the challenge that round are doubled for the purposes of combat resolution scores (up to the overkill maximum).

Artefact.Name: Executioner's Axe
Artefact.Description: Requires two hands. Strikes last. In close combat, the wielder counts as having a Strength double that of their target's Toughness, up to a maximum of Strength 10. In addition, the Executioner's Axe causes D3 wounds.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Ruin
Artefact.Description: No armour saves may be taken against hits from the Sword of Ruin.

Artefact.Name: Web of Shadows
Artefact.Rule: Enemy automatically takes 2D6 Strength 3 hits. One use only
Artefact.Description: One use only. The character uses the Web of Shadows instead of making any normal attacks that round. When used, one model in base contact with the character automatically takes 2D6 Strength 3 hits. Wounds caused do not carry over on to other models. A model with the Web of Shadows may instead choose to use a mundane weapon in any round of combat.

Artefact.Name: Chillblade
Artefact.Description: Enemy models suffering hits from the Chillblade must pass a Toughness test for every hit. If a test is failed the model suffers a wound with no armour save. Models suffering a wound (after ward saves, etc) may not make any close combat attacks that turn. No normal roll to wound is made for attacks with the Chillblade.

Artefact.Name: Heartseeker
Artefact.Description: The character may re-roll all failed rolls to hit and to wound in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Hydra Blade
Artefact.Rule: D3 additional attacks
Artefact.Description: A character wielding the Hydra Blade gains D3 additional attacks (roll just before making attacks).

Artefact.Name: Caledor's Bane
Artefact.Rule: Enemy may not use Scaly Skin saving
Artefact.Description: +3 Strength on the charge. Models may not use Scaly Skin saving throws against hits from Caledor's Bane.

Artefact.Name: Dagger of Hotek
Artefact.Description: The Dagger of Hotek is an additional hand weapon, (it can be used with a mundane hand weapon) and grants the bearer the Always Strikes First special rule.

Artefact.Name: Lifetaker
Artefact.Rule: Crossbow with Range 30", Strength 4, multiple shot x3, hits on a roll of 2+
Artefact.Description: Crossbow with Range 30", Strength 4, multiple shot x3. Lifetaker always hits on a roll of 2+, regardless of any to hit modifiers, magic items, etc.

Artefact.Name: Crimson Death
Artefact.Description: Requires two hands to use. A model wielding Crimson Death always strikes with Strength 6. No other modifiers or magic items can ever modify this.

Artefact.Name: Deathpiercer
Artefact.Description: Lance. Killing blow.

Artefact.Name: Whip of Agony
Artefact.Description: Beastmaster's scourge. A model wielding the Whip of Agony always strikes with Strength 5. No other modifiers or magic items can ever modify this.

Artefact.Name: Soulrender
Artefact.Description: Great weapon. Armour piercing.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Living Death
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. In addition, the model has +1 Toughness and +1 Wound. Roll a D6 before deploying any models. On a roll of a 1, the wearer succumbs to the Armour of Living Death and is subject to stupidity for the battle.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Eternal Servitude
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The wearer can Regenerate.

Artefact.Name: Cloak of Hag Graef
Artefact.Rule: Any ranged attack hits on the character have their Strength halved
Artefact.Description: Sea Dragon cloak. In addition, any ranged attack hits on the character (including shooting, magic missiles and other spells with a Strength value) have their Strength halved before rolling to wound (rounding up).

Artefact.Name: Armour of Darkness
Artefact.Description: This armour gives a total save of 1+ that cannot be further increased in any way (with a shield, chariot, mount and so on).

Artefact.Name: Shield of Ghrond
Artefact.Rule: All hits the character suffers will be resolved with -1 Strength
Artefact.Description: The Shield of Ghrond is treated like a normal shield, and in addition all hits the character suffers will be resolved with -1 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Blood Armour
Artefact.Rule: For every inflicted wound in close combat, armour save is improved by one point
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. For every unsaved wound the wearer inflicts in close combat, this save is improved by one point (to 4+ then 3+, etc) to a maximum total of 1 + (including any other bonuses for a shield. Sea Dragon cloak, and so on).

Artefact.Name: Black Amulet
Artefact.Rule: If ward save test is passed, the attacking model suffers 1 wound instead (with no armour save allowed)
Artefact.Description: The wearer has a 4+ ward save. If the wearer of the Black Amulet passes their ward save in close combat, then the attacking model suffers 1 wound instead (with no armour save allowed).

Artefact.Name: Ring of Darkness
Artefact.Rule: All attacks directed against the model are at half WS or half BS
Artefact.Description: All close combat attacks directed against the model are at half WS. Any shooting at the character or their unit is at half BS. Round fractions up.

Artefact.Name: Pendant of Khaeleth
Artefact.Rule: Ward save, based upon the Strength
Artefact.Description: This gives a ward save, based upon the Strength of the hit. Roll a D6 for every wound suffered by the wearer, on a roll equal to or under the attack's Strength, the hit is ignored. Rolls of 6 always fail.

Artefact.Name: Seal of Ghrond
Artefact.Description: Add 1 dice to the dispel dice pool.

Artefact.Name: Pearl of Infinite Bleakness
Artefact.Description: The character and his unit are Immune to Psychology.

Artefact.Name: Ring of Hotek
Artefact.Rule: Any Wizard (friend or foe) within 12" suffer a Miscast on the roll of any double
Artefact.Description: Any Wizard (friend or foe) attempting to cast or target a spell within 12" of the wearer will suffer a Miscast on the roll of any double.

Artefact.Name: Null Talisman
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: The Null Talisman grants magic resistance (1). Models may carry multiple Null Talismans, just like scrolls, and their effects are cumulative. For example, two Talismans confer magic resistance (2).

Artefact.Name: Black Staff
Artefact.Rule: Bound Spell, Power Level 4. Contains the Power of Darkness spell
Artefact.Description: Bound Spell, Power Level 4. Contains the Power of Darkness spell

Artefact.Name: Focus Familiar
Artefact.Rule: The wielder cast spells from a different position on the battlefield
Artefact.Description: The Focus Familiar allows the wielder to cast spells from a different position on the battlefield. Place a marker at the start of each Dark Elf Magic phase within 6" of the Sorceress and at least 1" away from enemies. She may use this position when determining range and line of sight for her spells, and whether she counts as in combat or not.

Artefact.Name: Darkstar Cloak
Artefact.Description: The cloak gives the Sorceress +1 power dice in each Magic phase. Only she may use this extra dice.

Artefact.Name: Sacrificial Dagger
Artefact.Rule: Sacrifice a model to get a casting dice
Artefact.Description: Once per spell-casting attempt, after the casting dice have been rolled, the Sorceress may sacrifice a model in a unit she has joined - the model is removed immediately. The Sorceress gains a power dice that must be rolled and added to the casting total (before dispel attempts). Note that it is possible for the unit to require a panic test if she sacrifices 25+% of the unit in a single Magic Phase!

Artefact.Name: Tome of Furion
Artefact.Rule: 1 additional spell
Artefact.Description: The Tome of Furion grants its bearer 1 additional spell.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Nagarythe
Artefact.Description: This standard gives an additional +1 to the combat resolution score of friendly units in combat within 12", and the unit containing the banner is Unbreakable

Artefact.Name: Hydra Banner
Artefact.Description: All models in the unit gain +1 Attack in the first round of any hand-to-hand combat (including mounts)

Artefact.Name: Dread Banner
Artefact.Description: The unit carrying this standard causes Fear

Artefact.Name: Standard of Slaughter
Artefact.Description: On any turn the unit with the Standard of Slaughter charges, the banner adds +D3 to the unit's combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Standard of Hag Graef
Artefact.Description: All models in the unit containing the Standard of Hag Graef gain the Always Strikes First rule.

Artefact.Name: Sea Serpent Standard
Artefact.Description: Corsairs only. The unit is subject to the rules for Frenzy.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Murder
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Banner of Murder gains the Armour Piercing rule.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Cold Blood
Artefact.Rule: Unit takes any Leadership tests on 3D6 and discards the highest D6, one use only
Artefact.Description: One use only. Announce that the unit is using the banner at the start of any player turn. For the duration of that turn, the unit containing the banner takes any Leadership tests on 3D6 and the Dark Elves player discards the highest D6 roll before comparing the score to the unit's Leadership value.

Individual.Rule: Any unit in Malekith's army that is within 12" of him automatically passes all panic tests

HandWeapon.Name: Destroyer
HandWeapon.Rule: Destroying magic items or castng Level on a D6 roll of 4+ for each successful hit

Armour.Name: Spellshield
Armour.Rule: If a spell cast at Malekith is dispelled by a dispel roll, the caster suffers a Strength 6 hit
For Bound Items, the Spellshield inflicts one Strength 6 hit

Option.Name: The Darksword
Option.Rule: Each wound inflicted on an enemy character or champion (after saves, etc) also deducts 1 from the model's S, A and T for the remainder of the game

Arcane.Name: Enchanting Beauty
Arcane.Rule: Any model in base contact with Morathi at the start of the Close Combat phase must pass a Leadership test or is reduced to Weapon Skill 1 until the end of the phase

Arcane.Name: The First Sorceress
Arcane.Rule: Knows all of the spells from the Lore of Dark Magic
In addition, Morathi adds +1 to all casting rolls

HandWeapon.Name: Parrying Blade
HandWeapon.Rule: One model in base contact loses one Attack (to a minimum of 1)

Arcane.Name: Amulet of Fire
Arcane.Rule: The first spell cast against Hellebron is dispelled on a D6 roll of 4+

Hero.Name: Malus Darkblade
Hero.Description: Malus Darkblade, Scion of Hag Graef

Demon.Name: Tz'arkan
Demon.Rule: If Malus is in base contact with a friendly model and not in contact with the enemy in any close combat phase, roll a D6. On a 1-3 Tz'arkan's murderous rage drives Malus to attack his allies

Individual.Rule: Any model that takes a wound from the Venom Sword (after saves, etc) must roll equal to or under its Toughness on 2D6 or automatically lose all remaining wounds.
Maximum Range: 12"; Strength: As user+1. Rules: Thrown weapon; multiple shot x3.
One model in base contact chosen by the Dark Elves player, or the model's opponent in a challenge, loses one Attack (to a minimum of 1)
Wounds inflicted in the challenge that round are doubled for the purposes of combat resolution scores

Hero.Name: Lokhir Fellheart
Hero.Description: Lokhir Fellheart, Captain of the Tower of Blessed Dread

HandWeapon.Name: The Red Blades
HandWeapon.Rule: Gains additional attacks in close combat equal to the number of ranks in the enemy unit he is attacking
